sen.j: 松平 忠周（まつだいら ただちか）、または松平 忠徳（まつだいら ただのり）、は、江戸時代中期の大名。
sen.e: Tadachika MATSUDAIRA (or Tadanori MATSUDAIRA) was a feudal lord who lived in the mid-Edo period.
Tadachika MATSUDAIRA (or Tadanori MATSUDAIRA) was a feudal lord who lived in the mid-Edo period.
Tadachika MATSUDAIRA (or Tadanori MATSUDAIRA) was a feudal lord who lived in the mid-Edo period.

sen.j: 伊賀守流藤井松平家3代。
sen.e: He was the third head of the Fujii-Matsudaira family which was one the families of Iga no kami.
He was the third head of the Fujii-Matsudaira family which was one the families of Iga no kami.
He was the third head of the Fujii-Matsudaira family which was one the families of Iga no kami (Governor of Iga Province).
sen.cmt: (Governor of Iga Province)説明補足しました。

sen.j: はじめ丹波国丹波亀山藩の第3代藩主。
sen.e: At first he became the third lord of Tanba-Kameyama Domain in Tanba Province.
At first he became the third lord of Tanba-Kameyama Domain in Tanba Province.
At first he became the third lord of Tanba-Kameyama Domain in Tanba Province.

sen.j: 次に武蔵国岩槻藩主。
sen.e: Then, the lord of the Iwatsuki Domain in Musashi Province.
Then, the lord of the Iwatsuki Domain in Musashi Province.
Then, the lord of the Iwatsuki Domain in Musashi Province.

sen.j: ついで但馬国出石藩主、そして信濃国上田藩の初代藩主。
sen.e: Next, the lord of the Izushi Domain in Tajima Province, then the first lord of Ueda Domain in Shinano Province.
Next, the lord of the Izushi Domain in Tajima Province, then the first lord of Ueda Domain in Shinano Province.
Next, the lord of the Izushi Domain in Tajima Province, then the first lord of Ueda Domain in Shinano Province.

sen.j: 江戸幕府では側用人、京都所司代、老中を歴任した。
sen.e: He hold positions such as Sobayonin (close associate), Kyoto Shoshidai (local governor of Kyoto) and Roju (the highest ranking government official) in the Edo bakufu(Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).

He held positions such as Sobayonin (close associate), Kyoto Shoshidai (local governor of Kyoto) and Roju (the highest ranking government official) in the Edo bakufu(Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).

He held positions such as Sobayonin (close associate), Kyoto Shoshidai (local governor of Kyoto) and Roju (the highest ranking government official) in the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: スペース補足しました。

sen.j: 万治4年（1661年）4月19日、藤井松平家（伊賀守流）主で丹波亀山藩の初代藩主である松平忠晴の三男として生まれる。
sen.e: He was born as the third son of Tadaharu MATSUDAIRA who was the head of the Fujii-Matsudaira family (the families of Iga no kami) and the first lord of Tanba-Kameyama Domain on April 19, 1661.
He was born as the third son of Tadaharu MATSUDAIRA who was the head of the Fujii-Matsudaira family (the families of Iga no kami) and the first lord of Tanba-Kameyama Domain on April 19, 1661.
He was born as the third son of Tadaharu MATSUDAIRA who was the head of the Fujii-Matsudaira family (the families of Iga no kami) and the first lord of Tanba-Kameyama Domain on May 17, 1661.

sen.j: 異母兄で亀山藩の第2代藩主・松平忠昭が病弱だったため、兄の養子となり、天和 (日本)3年（1683年）に家督を継いで亀山藩の第3代藩主となる。
sen.e: Since Tadaaki MATSUDAIRA who was his half brother and the second lord of Kameyama Domain was in a delicate health, Tadachika became his adopted child and inherited the family estate and assumed the position of the third lord of Kameyama Domain.

Since Tadaaki MATSUDAIRA who was his half brother and the second lord of Kameyama Domain was sickly, Tadachika became his adopted child and inherited the family estate and assumed the position as third lord of Kameyama Domain.

Since Tadaaki MATSUDAIRA who was his half brother and the second lord of Kameyama Domain was sickly, Tadachika became his adopted child and inherited the family estate and assumed the position as third lord of Kameyama Domain.

sen.j: 第5代将軍・徳川綱吉に近侍し、側用人にまで出世するが、徳川家宣が第6代将軍となると、側用人を免ぜられて幕政から遠ざけられる。
sen.e: He was a valet of the fifth Shogun Tsunayoshi TOKUGAWA and rose to the position of Sobayonin, but the sixth Shogun Ienobu TOKUGAWA dismissed him from office and kept him away from shogunate government.

He was a valet of the fifth Shogun Tsunayoshi TOKUGAWA and rose to the position of Sobayonin, but the sixth Shogun Ienobu TOKUGAWA dismissed him from office and kept him away from the shogunate government.

He was a valet of the fifth Shogun Tsunayoshi TOKUGAWA and rose to the position of Sobayonin, but the sixth Shogun Ienobu TOKUGAWA dismissed him from office and kept him away from the shogunate government.

sen.j: その後、8代将軍吉宗が登場すると京都所司代を経て老中に起用された。
sen.e: After that, the eighth Shogun Yoshimune used him on Kyoto Shoshidai, then Roju.
After that, the eighth Shogun Yoshimune used him on Kyoto Shoshidai, then Roju.
After that, the eighth Shogun Yoshimune used him on Kyoto Shoshidai, then Roju.

sen.j: 享保13年（1728年）5月1日、江戸で死去。
sen.e: He died on May 1, 1728 in Edo.
He died on May 1, 1728 in Edo.
He died on June 8, 1728 in Edo.

sen.j: 享年68。
sen.e: His age at death was 68.
His age at death was 68.
His age at death was 68.

sen.j: 後を三男・忠愛が継いだ。
sen.e: His third son, Tadazane succeeded to him.
His third son, Tadazane succeeded to him.
His third son, Tadazane succeeded to him.

sen.j: ※日付＝旧暦
sen.e: Lunar calendar used for the dates.
Lunar calendar used for the dates.
Lunar calendar used for the dates.

sen.j: 1661年（寛文元年）4月、誕生。
sen.e: Born in April, 1661.
Born in April, 1661.
Born in April, 1661.

sen.j: 生母は側室・木村氏（家臣の娘）。
sen.e: His mother was the Kimura clan who was a concubine (retainer's daughter).
His mother was from the Kimura clan who was a concubine (retainer's daughter).
His mother was from the Kimura clan who was a concubine (retainer's daughter).

sen.j: 1667年（寛文7年）閏2月、17歳年長の異母兄の世継ぎとなる。
sen.e: Became the hair to his half brother who was 17 years older than him in bissextile February 1667.
Became the heir to his half brother who was 17 years older than him in bissextile February 1667.
Became the heir to his half brother who was 17 years older than him in March 1667.

sen.j: 1679年（延宝7年）12月28日_(旧暦)、従五位下・阿波守に叙任。
sen.e: Given the rank of Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and position of Awa no kami (director of Awa) on December 28, 1679.
Given the rank of Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and position of Awa no kami (director of Awa) on December 28, 1679.
Given the rank of Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and position of Awa no kami (governor of Awa Province) on January 29, 1680.
sen.cmt: 新暦に訂正しました。(governor of Awa Province) 説明括弧訂正しました。

sen.j: 1683年（天和 (日本)3年）6月29日_(旧暦)、家督相続し、丹波国丹波亀山藩（藤井）松平家（伊賀守家）38000石を藩主として継承する。
sen.e: On June 29, 1683, inherited the family estate and succeeded 38,000 koku (Japanese measurement unit) of the (Fujii) Matsudaira family of Tanba-Kameyama Domain in Tanba Province as the lord.
On June 29, 1683, inherited the family estate and succeeded as lord of the 38,000 koku (Japanese measurement unit) (Fujii) Matsudaira family of Tanba-Kameyama Domain in Tanba Province.
On August 21, 1683, inherited the family estate and succeeded as lord of the 38,000 koku (Japanese measurement unit) (Fujii) Matsudaira family of Tanba-Kameyama Domain in Tanba Province.

sen.j: 7月3日、伊賀守に遷任。
sen.e: Moved to the position of Iga no kami (director of Iga) on July 3.
Moved to the position of Iga no kami (director of Iga) on July 3.
Moved to the position of Iga no kami (governor of Iga Province) on August 24.
sen.cmt: 新暦に訂正しました。(governor of Iga Province) 説明括弧訂正しました。

sen.j: 1685年（貞享2年）6月22日_(旧暦)、若年寄に就任。
sen.e: On June 22, 1685, assumed the position of Wakadoshiyori (junior councilors).
On June 22, 1685, assumed the position of Wakadoshiyori (junior councilors).
On July 23, 1685, assumed the position of Wakadoshiyori (junior councilors).

sen.j: 前は、詰衆。
sen.e: Previously assumed the position of Tsumeshu (guards of shogun).
Previously assumed the position of Tsumeshu (guards of shogun).
Previously assumed the position of Tsumeshu (guards of shogun).

sen.j: 忠徳を名乗る。
sen.e: Named himself Tadanori.
Named himself Tadanori.
Named himself Tadanori.

sen.j: 7月22日、側用人に転出。
sen.e: Transferred to the position of Sobayonin on July 22.
Transferred to the position of Sobayonin on July 22.
Transferred to the position of Sobayonin on August 21.

sen.j: 忠易を名乗る。
sen.e: Named himself Tadayasu.
Named himself Tadayasu.
Named himself Tadayasu.

sen.j: 1686年（貞享3年）1月21日_(旧暦)、武蔵国岩槻藩に転封。
sen.e: Changed his territory to Iwakuni Domain in Musashi Province on January 21, 1686.
Changed his territory to Iwakuni Domain in Musashi Province on January 21, 1686.
Changed his territory to Iwakuni Domain in Musashi Province on February 13, 1686.

sen.j: 1万石加増（計48000石）。
sen.e: Given 10,000 koku raise (48,000 koku in total).
Given a 10,000 koku raise (48,000 koku in total).
Given a 10,000 koku raise (48,000 koku in total).

sen.j: ところが移転費用が足らず、幕府から1万両を借り受ける。
sen.e: However, borrowed 10,000 ryo (Japanese monetary unit at the time) from the bakufu(Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) due to the lack of funds for relocation.
However, he borrowed 10,000 ryo (Japanese monetary unit at the time) from the bakufu(Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) due to the lack of funds for relocation.
However, he borrowed 10,000 ryo (Japanese monetary unit at the time) from the bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) due to the lack of funds for relocation.
sen.cmt: スペース補足しました。

sen.j: しかも、この時の加増、1万石については武蔵国岩槻藩領内に無く、和泉国の飛び地となった。
sen.e: In addition, the additional properties were not with in the territory of Iwatsuki Domain in Musashi Province but were the enclaves in Izumi Province.
In addition, the additional properties were not within the territory of Iwatsuki Domain in Musashi Province but in the enclaves of the Izumi Province.
In addition, the additional properties were not within the territory of Iwatsuki Domain in Musashi Province but in the enclaves of the Izumi Province.

sen.j: 丹波から武蔵までの移転は難しかったため、父・松平忠晴の墓は泉州へ移した。
sen.e: Since it was difficult to move from Tanba to Musashi, he moved the tombstone of his father, Tadaharu MATSUDAIRA to Senshu.
Since it was difficult to move from Tanba to Musashi, he moved the tombstone of his father, Tadaharu MATSUDAIRA to Senshu.
Since it was difficult to move from Tanba to Musashi, he moved the tombstone of his father, Tadaharu MATSUDAIRA to Senshu.

sen.j: 1689年（元禄2年）3月22日_(旧暦)、側用人御役御免。
sen.e: On March 22, 1689, dismissed from the position of Sobayonin.
On March 22, 1689, dismissed from the position of Sobayonin.
On May 11, 1689, dismissed from the position of Sobayonin.

sen.j: 1691年（元禄4年）、奥詰となる。
sen.e: Became an Okuzume (personal guards of shogun) in 1691.
Became an Okuzume (personal guards of shogun) in 1691.
Became an Okuzume (personal guards of shogun) in 1691.

sen.j: 1697年（元禄10年）2月11日_(旧暦)、但馬国出石藩への転封を言い渡される。
sen.e: Ordered to change his territory to Izushi Domain in Tajima Province on February 11, 1697.
Ordered to change his territory to Izushi Domain in Tajima Province on February 11, 1697.
Ordered to change his territory to Izushi Domain in Tajima Province on March 3, 1697.

sen.j: 同年5月、武州岩槻の後任・小笠原佐渡守へ引継ぎ。
sen.e: In May of the same year, trained Sado no kami Ogasawara as his replacement in Bushu-Iwatsuki.
In May of the same year, trained Sado no kami Ogasawara as his replacement in Bushu-Iwatsuki.
In May of the same year, trained Sado no kami Ogasawara as his replacement in Bushu-Iwatsuki.
sen.cmt: スペース削除しました。

sen.j: やがて先遣の家臣が、出石の前任・小出播磨守からも引継ぎを終えた。
sen.e: Later, the advance retainers concluded the handover from the predecessor of Izushi, Harima no kami Koide.
Later, the advance retainers concluded the handover from the predecessor of Izushi, Harima no kami Koide.
Later, the advance retainers concluded the handover from the predecessor of Izushi, Harima no kami Koide.

sen.j: 家中の移転は7月21日_(旧暦)からで、出石藩入りは8月9日_(旧暦)となった。
sen.e: The removal of the family started on July 21 and entered in Izushi Domain on August 9.
The transfer of the family started on July 21 who entered the Izushi Domain on August 9.
The transfer of the family started on September 6 who entered the Izushi Domain on September 23.

sen.j: 1705年（宝永2年）5月11日_(旧暦)、側用人に再任。
sen.e: On May 11, 1705, reappointed as Sobayonin.
On May 11, 1705, reappointed as Sobayonin.
On July 1, 1705, reappointed as Sobayonin.

sen.j: 忠徳を名乗る。
sen.e: Named himself Tadanori.
Named himself Tadanori.
Named himself Tadanori.

sen.j: 12月2日_(旧暦)、従四位下に昇叙。
sen.e: Promoted to the rank of Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) on December 2.
Promoted to the rank of Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) on December 2.
Promoted to the rank of Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) on January 16, 1706.

sen.j: 伊賀守如元。
sen.e: Remained in the position of Iga no kami.
Remained in the position of Iga no kami.
Retained his position as Iga no kami.

sen.j: 1706年（宝永3年）1月28日_(旧暦)、信濃国上田藩に転封し、1万石加増（計58000石）。
sen.e: Transferred his territory to Ueda Domain in Shinano Province on January 28, 1706 and given 10,000 koku raise (58,000 koku in total).
Transferred his territory to Ueda Domain in Shinano Province on January 28, 1706 and was given 10,000 koku raise (58,000 koku in total).
Transferred his territory to Ueda Domain in Shinano Province on March 12, 1706 and was given 10,000 koku raise (58,000 koku in total).

sen.j: 12月15日_(旧暦)、侍従兼任。
sen.e: Also assumed the position of chamberlain on December 15.
Also assumed the position of chamberlain on December 15.
Also assumed the position of chamberlain on January 18, 1707.

sen.j: 1708年（宝永5年）2月21日_(旧暦)、江戸藩邸に第5代将軍・徳川綱吉が来訪。
sen.e: The fifth Shogun Tsunayoshi TOKUGAWA visited his Edo hantei(residence maintained by a daimyo in Edo) on February 21, 1708.
The fifth Shogun Tsunayoshi TOKUGAWA visited his Edo hantei(residence maintained by a daimyo in Edo) on February 21, 1708.
The fifth Shogun Tsunayoshi TOKUGAWA visited his Edo hantei (residence maintained by a daimyo in Edo) on April 11, 1708.

sen.j: 1709年（宝永6年）1月17日_(旧暦)、側用人御役御免。
sen.e: Dismissed from the position of Shobayonin on January 17, 1709.
Dismissed from the position of Shobayonin on January 17, 1709.
Dismissed from the position of Shobayonin on February 26, 1709.

sen.j: 1717年（享保2年）9月27日_(旧暦)、京都所司代に就任。
sen.e: Assumed the position of Kyoto Shoshidai on September 27, 1717.
Assumed the position of Kyoto Shoshidai on September 27, 1717.
Assumed the position of Kyoto Shoshidai on October 31, 1717.

sen.j: 忠周を名乗る。
sen.e: Named himself Tadachika.
Named himself Tadachika.
Named himself Tadachika.

sen.j: 1724年（享保9年）12月15日_(旧暦)、老中に就任。
sen.e: Assumed the position of Roju on December 15, 1724.
Assumed the position of Roju on December 15, 1724.
Assumed the position of Roju on January 28, 1725.

sen.j: 1728年（享保13年）5月1日 (旧暦)、在職のまま死去。
sen.e: He died on May 1, 1728 when he was in office.
He died on May 1, 1728 when he was in office.
He died on June 8, 1728 when he was in office.

sen.j: 享年68。
sen.e: His age at death was 68.
His age at death was 68.
His age at death was 68.

sen.j: 第8代将軍・徳川吉宗もその死を悼み、大久保佐渡守に銀300枚を持たせ、弔慰に遣わした。
sen.e: The eighth Shogun Yoshimune TOKUGAWA also mourned over his death and sent Sado no kami Okubo for condolence with 300 silver coins.
The eighth Shogun Yoshimune TOKUGAWA also mourned his death and sent Sado no kami Okubo as a sign of his condolences along with 300 silver coins.
The eighth Shogun Yoshimune TOKUGAWA also mourned his death and sent Sado no kami Okubo as a sign of his condolences along with 300 silver coins.

sen.j: 人品、文武の両道、共に優れ、和歌への造詣も深かった。
sen.e: He had an exceptional personality and was both a good warrior and a good scholar, also he was knowledgeable about waka(Japanese poem).
He had an exceptional personality and was both a good warrior and scholar, and was knowledgeable about waka(Japanese poem).
He had an exceptional personality and was both a good warrior and scholar, and was knowledgeable about waka (Japanese poem).
sen.cmt: スペース補足しました。

sen.j: 京都所司代の頃には、たびたび公卿から歌会に招かれていた。
sen.e: He was often invited to Utakai (waka poetry meeting) by Kugyo (the top court officials) when he was a Kyoto Shoshidai.
He was often invited to Utakai (waka poetry meeting) by Kugyo (the top court officials) when he was a Kyoto Shoshidai.
He was often invited to Utakai (waka poetry meeting) by Kugyo (the top court officials) when he was a Kyoto Shoshidai.

sen.j: 好感を得られる人柄からか、武家にしては、柔和な人物と思われたのだろう。
sen.e: Maybe he was considered to be a meek person for Samurai because he made a favorable impression on people.
He may have been considered to be a meek person by Samurai because he made a favorable impression on people.
He may have been considered to be a meek person by Samurai because he made a favorable impression on people.

sen.j: 徳川吉宗は、忠周の頻繁な歌会参加を聞き及んでも、特に咎めることも無かった。
sen.e: Although Yoshimune TOKUGAWA heard that Tadachika frequently joined Utakai, he never blamed Tadachika on that.
Although Yoshimune TOKUGAWA heard that Tadachika frequently joined Utakai, he never blamed Tadachika for this.
Although Yoshimune TOKUGAWA heard that Tadachika frequently joined Utakai, he never blamed Tadachika for this.
sen.cmt: 余分なスペースを削除しました。

sen.j: その歌会仲間のツテで、伊勢物語の講にも参加。
sen.e: Also, he joined a seminar of "Ise Monogatari" through the influence of Utakai mates.
He also joined a seminar of "Ise Monogatari" through the influence of Utakai compatriots.
He also joined a seminar of "Ise Monogatari" through the influence of Utakai compatriots.

sen.j: 講が終わって、ある公卿が在原業平を羨む発言した。
sen.e: After the seminar, a kugyo made a envious statement on ARIHARA no Narihira.
After the seminar, a kugyo made statement expressing envy towards ARIHARA no Narihira.
After the seminar, a kugyo made statement expressing envy towards ARIHARA no Narihira.

sen.j: その場の公卿は、賛同する者がほとんどだったというが、忠周一人が座を正し、下記のように諫言した。
sen.e: Most of kugyo agreed on that statement, but only Tadachika drew up and expostulated below.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Most of the kugyo agreed with this statement, but only Tadachika stood up to say below.
Most of the kugyo agreed with this statement, but only Tadachika stood up to say below.
sen.cmt: 原文に「下記のように」を追加し、「」内の文章を下記に分割し、「」で囲みました。

sen.j: 「諸卿の言、みな非なり。」
sen.e: "Things that said by you are all false.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: "All that you say is false..
'All that you say is false.'
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。余分なピリオド削除しました。

sen.j: 「今もし、不義濫行その如きもの在らば、それがし、苟（いやしく）も東府の目代なり。」
sen.e: I can not pass over it when I hear anything ungrateful now. I am anything but a deputy of the Edo governor.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: I can not ignore anything that is expresses ungratefullness. I am anything but a deputy of the Edo governor.
'I can not ignore anything that is expresses ungratefulness. I am anything but a deputy of the Edo governor.'

sen.j: 「職に於いて赦さず、速やかに召し捕えて罪を論じ、刑に処さん。」
sen.e: So I won't allow your words with my obligations. I will arrest and accuse you immediately. You have to be assigned a penalty."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: I can not allow your words to pass with my obligations. Therefore you will be arrested immediately and be punished."
'I can not allow your words to pass with my obligations. Therefore you will be arrested immediately and be punished.'
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。

sen.j: この一事が、やがて江戸にまで届き、吉宗将軍の聞き及ぶ所となった。
sen.e: The rumor of this event spread to Edo and finally reached Shogun Yoshimune's ears.
The rumor of this event spread to Edo and finally reached Shogun Yoshimune's ears.
The rumor of this event spread to Edo and finally reached Shogun Yoshimune's ears.

sen.j: 吉宗は「余が見る処は、違わざるなり」と満悦。
sen.e: Yoshimune contentedly said "That is the man who is worthy of my confidence."
Yoshimune contentedly said "That is the man who is worthy of my confidence."
Yoshimune contentedly said 'That is the man who is worthy of my confidence.'
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。

sen.j: 老中抜擢の端緒であったという。
sen.e: It was the preface of Tadachika's being selected as Roju.
This was the start of Tadachika's being selected as Roju.
This was the start of Tadachika's being selected as Roju.

sen.j: 長男、次男、四男は早世。
sen.e: His first son, second son and forth son died young.
His first son, second son and forth son died young.
His first son, second son and forth son died young.

sen.j: 三男・忠愛が嫡子となり家督を継いだ。
sen.e: His third son, Tadazane became the progeny and inherited the family estate.
His third son, Tadazane inherited the family estate.
His third son, Tadazane inherited the family estate.

sen.j: 五男・忠容は5000石を与えられ、大身旗本の分家を興した。
sen.e: His fifth son, Tadayasu was given 5,000 koku and established the branch family of Taishin Hatamoto (direct weighty retainer of the shogun).
His fifth son, Tadayasu was given 5,000 koku and established the branch family of Taishin Hatamoto (direct weighty retainer of the shogun).
His fifth son, Tadayasu was given 5,000 koku and established the branch family of Taishin Hatamoto (direct weighty retainer of the shogun).

sen.j: 六男・忠陣、七男・忠弘は藤井姓を称した。
sen.e: His sixth son, Tadajin(忠陣) and seventh son, Tadahiro took Fuji as the family name.
sen.cmt: 忠陣→Tadajin(忠陣)［正しい読み方が不明です］
sen.e: His sixth son, Tadajin(忠陣) and seventh son, Tadahiro took Fuji as the family name.
His sixth son, Tadajin (忠陣) and seventh son, Tadahiro took Fuji as the family name.
sen.cmt: スペース補足しました。

sen.j: このほか、他家に嫁いだ娘が5人いる。
sen.e: Also, there were five daughters who married into other families.
Also, there were five daughters who married into other families.
Also, there were five daughters who married into other families.
